---
title: "Python builtins"
---
<div set:html={`
          <section id="python-builtins">
<h1>Python builtins<a class="headerlink" href="#python-builtins" title="Link to this heading">¶</a></h1>
<p>Some common python builtins have equivalent <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">algopy</span></code> versions, that use an <a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.UInt64" title="algopy.UInt64"><span class="xref myst py py-class"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">UInt64</span></code></span></a> instead of a native <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">int</span></code>.</p>
<section id="len">
<h2>len<a class="headerlink" href="#len" title="Link to this heading">¶</a></h2>
<p>The <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">len()</span></code> builtin is not supported, instead <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">algopy</span></code> types that have a length have a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">.length</span></code> property of type <a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.UInt64" title="algopy.UInt64"><span class="xref myst py py-class"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">UInt64</span></code></span></a>. This is primarily
due to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">len()</span></code> always returning <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">int</span></code> and the CPython implementation enforcing that it returns <em>exactly</em> <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">int</span></code>.</p>
</section>
<section id="range">
<h2>range<a class="headerlink" href="#range" title="Link to this heading">¶</a></h2>
<p>The <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">range()</span></code> builtin has an equivalent <a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.urange" title="algopy.urange"><span class="xref myst py py-class"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">algopy.urange</span></code></span></a> this behaves the same as the python builtin except that it returns
an iteration of <a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.UInt64" title="algopy.UInt64"><span class="xref myst py py-class"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">UInt64</span></code></span></a> values instead of <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">int</span></code>.</p>
</section>
<section id="enumerate">
<h2>enumerate<a class="headerlink" href="#enumerate" title="Link to this heading">¶</a></h2>
<p>The <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">enumerate()</span></code> builtin has an equivalent <a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.uenumerate" title="algopy.uenumerate"><span class="xref myst py py-class"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">algopy.uenumerate</span></code></span></a> this behaves the same as the python builtin except that it returns
an iteration of <a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.UInt64" title="algopy.UInt64"><span class="xref myst py py-class"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">UInt64</span></code></span></a> index values and the corresponding item.</p>
</section>
<section id="reversed">
<h2>reversed<a class="headerlink" href="#reversed" title="Link to this heading">¶</a></h2>
<p>The <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">reversed()</span></code> builtin is supported when iterating within a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">for</span></code> loop and behaves the same as the python builtin.</p>
</section>
<section id="types">
<h2>types<a class="headerlink" href="#types" title="Link to this heading">¶</a></h2>
<p>See <a class="reference internal" href="../lg-types.html#python-built-in-types"><span class="std std-ref">here</span></a></p>
</section>
</section>

        `} />
